Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at worse!”
Reviews.Author: traytableupright
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but very clean, as with most hotels the pillows are hopeless but overall an ok place to stay if you need to be in the area. Reception were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GolfNutCanberra
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney to see a specific show so had plenty of time in the hotel. Good deal (Wotif) and the hotel is in a great location near Kings Cross. Room faced over back yards of houses and into windows of apartments behind. Choose carefully if you want a view. Pool is outdoor, opens post 7am and closes around 10pm. One of the lifts wasn't working on the day a flood of overseas tourists arrived. Took ages to get to the room. Same when we left, slow getting to the carpark. They are missing some of the Digital TV channels (One HD in particular), no ecuse it's just the way it is. Buffet breakfast was just OK. Probably better off walking to Kings Cross and having McDonalds at the low end or one of the nice cafes at the upper end.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms not so clean....”
Reviews.Author: TintininOz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Vibe Rushcutters Bay in March 2012 to see the Picasso Exhibition at the Art Gallery of NSW, we got a great deal, which is why I love Vibes promos. The staff were polite, and helpful. The location is just great, it is walking distance to Darlinghurst/Kings Cross where we found some great places to eat, (in particular a great Thai place up the hill to Kings Cross called Two Seats, forget Elvis Pizza across the road from the Vibe, it was disgusting!) to get into the city it costs around $10-20 in a taxi. So you don't have to drive in and pay ridiculous carparking fees! The cleanliness of the rooms really let the place down, as soon as we walked into the bathroom there were hairs here and there, not what you want to see! And sitting on the toilet I couldn't take my eyes off the grouting in the tiles that had stains all over them, it looked like someone had vomitted into the basin and it wasn't cleaned up properly..... seedy! The room just had that, not well cleaned feeling which makes you feel abit icky?! The ledge behind/beside the bed looked like it had never been wiped too.... Im sure you are getting the picture.... As for room service.... forget it! We ordered an asian tasting plate, (one of the cheaper things on the menu) sounds great hey?! We received the smallest bamboo steamer you can buy filled with what looked like the $6 frozen yum cha selection you buy at Woolies! We paid $17 for it.... we also ordered wedges with sour cream, that was alittle too sour...: ( Overall we had a great weekend in Sydney, despite Vibe's failings, they have a good bunch of hotels that we have stayed in all over the country, they might just need to work on a couple of things or people will stop returning....

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money - stayed here twice - will return”
Reviews.Author: ladycatrin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in king rooms with park views. I am fussy and cannot fault this hotel. Having stayed in expensive hotels on many occasions, this hotel is half the price and almost as good as the expensive ones. I have found the rooms to be of a high quality and the beds/pillows are wonderful. (The rooms without a view are larger to compensate for the lack of views). All rooms are equipped with a small safe, and all the standard conveniences you expect. At only $140 per night it represents fantastic value. Pros: Easy walk to Kings Cross & surrounds for restaurants / bars. Easy to catch train to Circular Quay, The Rocks (Opera House & Sydney Harbour Bridge) or a taxi for only $13, in-house restaurant/bar, room service (good food & coffee), nice reception & restaurant staff. Taxis constantly at front reception, central to everything. Quick proximity to Sydney airport. Negative : The heating button in my room on one of my stays didn't work but the temperature was ok anyway, the in-room safe key pad wasn't working. On my second stay the suite on level 6 was booked by a wedding party who were screaming, clapping, cheering, singing etc from their room until 2 in the morning. I complained and I give full credit to the night staff who immediately came to see me, agreed that the noise was excessive and offered me another room. They then sorted out the crowd inside, so I cannot fault their management of the situation. Great staff. Overall, for the price and the location - brilliant. Look forward to staying there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but felt like aan upmarket youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: global_nomad_pacific
Reviews.Content: Pros Location is great - right on Rushcutter bay, the breakfast at the hotel looked pretty awful so we had breakfast at the kiosk in the park every day which was simple but lovely. Also within walking distance to Paddington and PottsPoint. Its ok if you are looking for something clean and no-frills. Free newspapers in the lobby. Staff tried to be helpful. Dont go expecting too much and you will be happy Cons The hotel really felt like an upmarket youth hostel. The keys that you needed to swipe to get up the lifts never seemed to work, There always seemed to be used room service trays lying about the passage ways. Our room was noisy and - with noise from the road and from other guests standing in talking in the passage ways. The hotel seemed to be very popular with Qantas crew - it was very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed several times and will again.”
Reviews.Author: JeremyC-99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions over the past 5 years because it represents a very good value hotel option relatively close to the CBD. My stays have been both for work and leisure purposes and usually in King Rooms but also on one occasion in a twin room. On every occasion I have found the hotel smart and spotlessly clean. The rooms and bathrooms are of a good size and comfortable. I have found the beds a little on the firm side but otherwise good. Service has been friendly on each occasion. I have used the restaurant on occasion for breakfast and also for evening meals. The food is fine by hotel standards. There is a good restaurant at 88 Bayswater Road (called 88 Bay or 88 Bay) which is easy to get to and with good food. The hotel is right next to Rushcutters Park which makes for a pleasant recreational space to escape to - as compared to CBD hotels. There is internet in the rooms but you have to pay (I really think Sydney Hotels should be providing this service free by now). There are some computers in the foyer and I think there is free access for a limited time (check this). I have found the hotel quiet in all of the rooms I have used. A BIG plus at Vibe is the Secure and Free Parking if you are travelling by car. This represents a saving of $45 to $65 per night on the fees at all of the Sydney CBD hotels I have stayed at in recent times.

Reviews.Title: “Pool nice, but very loud”
Reviews.Author: SassyTas
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights as part of a conference. Conference facilities were not great with a long, narrow room that made it difficult to see the panel up the front and there was a lot of sound issues which was a bit distracting. I was booked into a deluxe park view room - the view was of the apartment building behind with a sliver of a view of the park. Bathroom was dated. Rest of the room was fine. But kept awake at night due to a very loud fan. Not sure if it was the fan on the roof, as I was on the 6th floor, or where but loud humming that was very annoying. My colleague who had a room on the 1st floor also commented that it was noisy, though people not fans. With the exception of one staff member who took over ten minutes to check in my colleague, and I think messed it up due to someone else trying to come into the room later, the staff were friendly and helpful. Ordered room service and wasn't happy when the burger came with the addition of mayonaise that wasnt stated to be on it - as I am pregnant I am a little paranoid. Had to ring room service to confirm the mayo didn't have raw egg in it. Resolved quickly but was initially met with doubt that the mayonnaise wasn't stated on the menu. Park next door was nice for a walk and the pool area was nice. Buffet breakfast was standard and fine. Close bus service made getting into the CBD easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel3122
Reviews.Content: Great location for eastern suburbs base. Not too far from city. Easy walk to Paddington, Elizabeth Bay and Potts Point. Lots of eating options nearby. Good sized room with huge bed. Rooftop pool is nice way to spend a relaxing hour or so. Rushcutter's park right next door. Service wasn't that great but no major issues. Minibar expensive, use convenience store up the road. Late night room service was pricey but worth it - the ham & cheese toastie was delicious (@2am). Would definitely stay again at discount rates.

Reviews.Title: “Slow and inexperienced staff - but OK aprt from that”
Reviews.Author: KB100255060
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Might have been the time I arrived but the service at the front desk was very slow. A couple of times during the stay the person attending me had to ask someone else. Service at the restaurant very slow for a midweek thta was not busy. Room OK, but other I was with indicated that their bathroom was not cleaned from the day before

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: courtneticus
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, the lady at the front desk told me they had no twin rooms available even though we booked and prepaid for it, but she would talk to her manager and see what they could do. She came back, gave us our free breakfast cards, and sent us up to the room. When we got there, it was two twin beds pushed together to make a king bed. We called the front desk and they said they'd send housekeeping right up. 30 minutes later we called again because no one had shown up. They said they'd send someone immediately. 30 minutes later, still no one. We called again and they finally showed up. There was also a used breakfast request card from a previous guest in our room and a light was burned out in the bathroom. Housekeeping and the people at the front desk did not care. The breakfast buffet was terrible. The milk sits out without any ice to keep it cold, the food is stale, and it was the exact same menu for the 4 days we stayed there. When we went to check out, the same lady who checked us in was there. She said I owed money for internet charges and for 4 days of meals at the restaurant. I told her the internet charges were valid, but she gave us a free breakfast card for 4 days. She looked at me like I was a liar and after 5 minutes of telling her that I was not going to pay for it, she said okay and just made me pay for the internet. I'm now home and I see a charge for $150 on my credit card from the hotel! I've contacted their corporate customer service to get this resolved because the quality of staff at this hotel is so poor. This was the worst experience I've ever had at a hotel. Also, they only give you a duvet on the beds and it is too short to be pulled up to the top of the beds so sleeping is uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Standards are slipping!”
Reviews.Author: Trembler49
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Vibe for around 10 years now and the dear old place is now in need of a refurb. It's still a good location and not a bad hotel, but it's age is showing. Front of house staff are very pleasant, but housekeeping is not as thorough as it could be. Shame. Plus AUD25 per day for Wifi is a bit steep. I am typing this review from Singapore using free Wifi. Prices in Australia, and in particular Sydney are really getting out of hand.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: Staff were overly friendly and helpful! The room was lovely, very spacious and all fixtures & furntiure in a very modern & good confdition! Rooftop pool was a lvely bonus and very warm too! Views and park right next door was a blessing (esp when you have a toddler) Could't fault the plce! Would highly recommend this as a great Sydney hotel to any guests coming to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Whibs
Reviews.Content: We've only just checked in and it took FOREVER! Here's the list so far: 1. Given room 517 - where we found someone already sleeping. 2. Then given room 417 - with only one bed when we booked a twin room. 3. Given room 436 - which hadn't yet been cleaned, so we had to wait. 4. While we were waiting 6 different people came to the service desk to complain about various issues such as: no toilet paper, keys not working, no blankets, etc... 5. Spoke to the manager, who just made excuses and told us he'd get back to us tomorrow. We're hoping for a SIGNIFICANT improvement tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Prime spot for Sydney to Hobart start”
Reviews.Author: Bamse64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our 5 day stay over Christmas to see off our son &the rest of the crew in the Syd- Hobart yacht race on Boxing day. Some of them also stayed here.The staff were cheerfully casual & helpful, the breakfasts were good in the big indoor\outdoor dining room next to the park, & rooms were comfortable. There is a casual bar downstairs handy for catching up with interstate friends when much else is closed. A plus in the heat was the rooftop pool with some views of Rushcutters Bay. A 5 minute stroll through Rushcutters Bay park led past the small coffee, breakfast and lunch kiosk(very inexpensive}to the yacht club, open to the public not just crew &hangers on like us,where it was great to enjoy excellent meals under umbrellas looking out on the harbour & the jumble of yachts.We would book it again as long as rooms facd into the park.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service non-existent!”
Reviews.Author: Drfab1
Reviews.Content: Room small but ok (at best). Customer service appalling. Had a simple problem, was promised multiple times that someone would help or "call me straight back". Long story short 2 HOURS of someone will be up soon, 5 phone calls ( all from me) and a trip to the lobby I was called back and told the problem couldn't be fixed. And they werent particularly apologetic. Avoid!!!! There is much better for the cost

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Threadbare. Grotty.”
Reviews.Author: emma y
Reviews.Content: Having stayed a few years ago on a number of occasions and thought the hotel was groovy minimalist, it is now threadbare, grotty and disappointing. A junior suite gets you a dirty view of the traffic on New South Head Rd, despite promotional photos of harbor views. What sets it apart from a deluxe room is a nasty doctor's waiting room style lounge area. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe Hotel Rushcutters - A word of Warning”
Reviews.Author: ctas888
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was good and for the purpose I needed it for - a basic overnight stay and the price I paid - it was fine. The problems happened afterwas they requested a $100 security deposit on my credit card- even though the room had been prepaid. On checkout I was told there were no problems and this amount would be returned to my card the next day. It is now a month later and this amount has not been credited back to my limit - despite a previous phone call and promises otherwise that faxes have been sent. I have since made a second call , so hopefully it will resolve soon but I am dissapointed in the amount of time it has taken to release this amount (almost a month) and the time the multiple phone calls and emails this has taken. It's a shame , the hotels service is letting down what would be otherwise quite a good hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Just "OK"”
Reviews.Author: Sonja N
Reviews.Content: Everything seemed ok on the surface - easy parking, easy check-in, room was ok. Next time I think I would pay an extra $50 and stay closer to the city though.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Moby-Wan
Reviews.Content: Great location, good buffet breakfast, attentive service. what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Pedrovski
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel from Wotif and were pleasantly surprised. Staff and service were great. Downstairs bar a great place for a drink. Rooftop pool has great views and the surrounding parkland cafe a great place for a Sunday morning coffee. God location just out of the city and close to the sights of Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night and a very poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Magpie92
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving for a one night stay, we were greeted with a very low standard of service which unfortunately continued throughout the next 24 hours. We checked into our allocated room ($220) and found that it was not only small and pokey, it was also a disabled room. The shower was surrounded by a short curtain and all the shower water lapped around the entire bathroom floor. I would be on the toilet after having a shower an hour before and have my own shower water at my feet. Disgusting. Then there was no TV remote for the small LCD TV. After the wedding we attended, we hopped into bed to find that the 'standard room' bed was in fact two beds thrown together and could feel the gap between the two beds. Breakfast the next morning was appalling, particularly the eggs and bacon. I am no chef and I could have easily done better. I have stayed at Vibe hotels before and this was a rude shock. The only good thing was its location, next to a lovely park and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJT82
Reviews.Content: We booked a deal on LastMinute.com for 5 nights including New Years Eve. The money we paid was a superb deal and being a 10 minute walk to the trains and 10 minute ride to the main city attractions was not a problem at all. Bondi is only 1 stop away by train which was handy too! I'd say the location was great. The room was comfortable and very clean. Only problem we had was ending up with a room near the lifts - you do hear everyone get in and out! Roof top pool was a welcome surprise as we had no idea it was there! I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Harbour One Side/Kings Cross the Other Side”
Reviews.Author: CamnViv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and teh Checkin staff were friendly. The Room was a typical Hotel room with nothing really to stand out. The Queens bed I had was two beds pushed together with the usual crack in the middle. Teh Windows look out on apartments across teh road and unless you have the blind screen down peope can fully see in to you room if they happen to look. Breakfasts were you usual Bain Maree with Bacon Scrambled Eggs, Fresh Fruit etc. they also catered for the Japanese with Miso Soup. Nice to sit outside on the terrace and eat breakfast there. Five hundred metres one way is a great park where there is heaps of activity both morning and night. Joggers Persaonal Fitness Trainers. Dogs on the loose having fun etc. Rushcutters harbour is beautiful to walk by and you can see lots of boats and yachts and dream. Theer also is a nice cafe there in teh park as well. Walking up the Hill from teh Hotel takes you to Kings Cross which has afew swanky restaurants along with a lot of seedy bars. Overall if you want easy access to the city, like walking in the park it maybe the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DGEC22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the only hotel in SYD that was not charging in excess of $600/night for New Years Eve. They required a few night minimum nonetheless. The hotel is a bit out of the way, but there is a gorgeous park that surrounds it. The staff was somewhat clueless and took a lengthy period of time to fulfill requests. The rooms are no frills but clean, though I didn't like the fact that you had to use your room key to keep the lights on in the room. Very easy to leave your room with your key still inside. They offered a breakfast buffet which was nice & convenient. You can also inquire on getting coupons to lower the price as it's a bit pricey for one person. The pool deck was a nice touch, though very minimal lounge chairs (apx 4). I think the hotel needs a face lift. The lobby/lounge area is dark and stagnant. The neighborhood is drab with nothing going on. Overall, clean rooms, but would probably stay elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ideal”
Reviews.Author: SAXONY
Reviews.Content: We found the location of this Hotel was not ideal due to the fact it so far away from the centre of Sydney You either have to get an expensive taxi or cross over two main highways to get to the bus stop The hotel has a basic lobby and the corridors are dark and depressing It is the only Hotel we have stayed where you have to swipe your room key in the lift to reach your floor. There is something about the feel of this hotel that lacks the personal touch even though the staff were friendly enough Even though we had a confirmed booking the reception had no knowledge of it The room we were given was on the side of the building and over looked the railway. After talking with the manager we were moved to a room facing the Park. Outside the Hotel is a bit rundown with just a few shops

Reviews.Title: “There are much better places to stay - bad location, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAust
Reviews.Content: I generally like Vibe Hotels - I stay in the VIbe Savoy in Melbourne often, and it is always a superlative experience. This hotel is the complete opposite - run down, bad value, frustrating staff. We paid $300 for a night in a hotel that is a 1km uphill walk to the nearest train station (in King's Cross). It was very difficult to get consistent information from staff - we booked this hotel because it had a rooftop pool, which would have been an excellent vantage point for the New Year's Eve fireworks. We asked four different staff members whether or not this would be open, and got different answers each times. The fourth, slightly more senior, staff member assured us it would be, but when we went to go up at about 10.30pm, there was no access to the roof, forcing us to make quick changes to our plans. There are 'Vibe Guides To' brochures each of their locations in a display in the lobby. They have a price on the front ($2.99), but then they say 'free to guests' underneath (who would pay for a brochure???). These guides contain a 2-for-1 for main meals for the on-site Curve Restaurant and Bar. Great value - but why hide it away in these guides? Breakfast is available in the restaurant for $26. Or you can buy a voucher the day before from reception for $15. The information about this offer is on a brochure in the room. Which means another trip down to reception to get the voucher before the next morning. The rooms are starting to look a little shabby. This hotel opened in 1999 as the Rushcutters Harbourside Sydney, before becoming a Vibe Hotel. My suspicion is that this hotel was put up in a rush to capitalise on the sailing events held in Rushcutters Bay during the 2000 Sydney Olympics, and that poor workmanship is starting to show through. The rooftop pool is amazing, if a little crowded. There is a clear 'No Glass' rule, but on New Year's Eve we had a very frustrating experience. My husband and I were in the pool, and some girls were by the poolside drinking wine out of their glasses. Inevitably, one of the glasses smashed, and when one of the staff eventually came up around 6pm, she just stood there chatting with the girl for about half an hour, ignoring the smashed glass, and everyone else with glasses. It wouldn't have been a great start to New Year's Eve to have glass embedded in my foot after getting out of the pool. It is incredibly frustrating that the hotel couldn't foresee this - it is a hotel with a rooftop pool overlooking Sydney Harbour on New Year's Eve! Sticking some plastic cups the door would have been a welcome initiative - but even more frustrating that they didn't deal with it. Bits of glass in the astroturf next to the pool is just dangerous. Stop talking, and get out your vacuum.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, service poor”
Reviews.Author: Clay135
Reviews.Content: Room service CONSTANTLY late, buffet breakfast over priced and poor quality, noisy rooms with thin walls, bar shuts early but you "can still sit in the dark if you wish". Counter staff friendly and helpfull however can't make up for other oversights. Don't pay too much to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “frustrating - no response from website or hotel...”
Reviews.Author: enjyn
Reviews.Content: This wasn't the best hotel for our needs, but we booked at the last minute and through Expedia. The hotel itself was ok. Very little privacy, you could hear every other door slam in the entire hotel. The location wasn't the most convenient if you like to travel by public transportation (steep hike up the 'hill' to the metro station). Wouldn't stay there again! We booked the room while on board a cruise ship and ran into internet difficulties, consequently we booked two rooms for one night instead of one room for one night. When we got to the hotel and registered there was no mention that we had two rooms. The rooms weren't ready and so we left the bags in the luggage hold and went to explore Sydney. When we returned the girl at the front desk asked if we were supposed to have two rooms. We told her that we weren't and she said no problem, we can refund the second room. We made it back home and when I checked my credit card statement, I had two charges. When I contacted Expedia, they said that they could not refund the charges without the manager's (of the hotel) approval and that I would need to contact the hotel myself. I called the hotel directly and I was hung up on once and after calling back spending about 15 minutes talking to someone at the front desk was told that the person who Expedia was communicating with is unavailable and that she could send me an email since they were unwilling to make an international long distance call. This irritated me since I was making an international long distance call so that I could call Expedia back and say 'yes, I talked to the desk manager and you can refund my money'. I left my email address and phone number and was never contacted. The time difference between my home location and there is only 2 hours, so it wasn't a matter of time. I sent an email through the website's "Contact Us" section relaying all of the information and the names of the people I had spoken to all along the way. I have not received any sort of response. I listed two different email addresses and two phone numbers. I have spent $356 for a room that should have be $175. Even if the money couldn't have been refunded due to expedia/hotel policies, the lack of communication has made me swear off of any of the Vibe hotels and to not recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Ian G
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Darlinghurst and Paddington. Usually a good low price you wouldn't want to pay too much for this hotel. Rooms are noisey - if someone sneezes next door you will hear it. Doors to rooms slam shut. Housekeeping do not know how to be quiet - talking loudly in corridors, banging walls, vacuuming at odd hours and leaving dirty linen/carts up and down corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Book Very Early - Use The Park and Sailing Clubs and Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: travelsgood
Reviews.Content: Stayed 27 Dec 2010 - 2nd Feb 2011. BOTTOM LINE Book way ahead, research using your favourite discount website, then call the hotel and get a cash quote, it may be better than the Internet deal. As the cost of rooms is not good value for money if you book for "tonight". Ask to see the room. Top floor was relatively quiet but adjacent rooms are not soundproofed enough so you"ll be able to hear the TV. It seems that that have contract with a Australian Airline as many Staff were checking in/out on most of the higher floors during my stay. The place was refurbished for the Olympic Games in 2000 and requires an update. Breakfast $5 good deal, large coffee & pastry and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. Staff : customer service was okay but most of the staff need a refresher on customer service or need training. Poor cross departmental communication. Fridge maintenance order was not properly actioned - had to call at least twice. They offered a change of room or some ice which was great but maintenance never got round to get it working. So I got staff to store my stuff in their fridge. Cool. No followup call regarding " all fixed everything ok??? " Heated Pool is good with nice views. Gym needs rejuvenation - equipment is old, some have rust on them. Sauna - did not try. Stayed on top floor - best floor -- book early as you do not want to pay full price One morning the cleaner was vacuuming a room around 7.30am and a half naked guest (perhaps an Airline Pilot or Steward) opposite the room popped their head out like Me in shock. Save on breakfast : Catch breakfast at Rushcutters bay park at 7.30am - 8 am, even to the Sailing Clubs or walk to kings cross for less than $10 breakfast specials. Morning Papers: to right of facing reception get a copy before the taxi drivers get them Wifi - You have to pay. Just go to the Kings Cross Library or Kings Cross Internet Cafes. Lift to pool was not functioning a few times (used stairs) and was fixed. Only 1 lift to pool & gym.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty budget hotel masquerading as 'urban' and 'cool'”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: The vibe hotel is owned by the Toga Hospitality group - the same owners as the Travelodge chain of budget hotels in Australia (different to UK / USA T'lodge). And that, in essence, is what you get at this Vibe hotel - a run of the mill Travelodge with a touch of lime and purple paint - at double the price. The advertise themselves as a 4 star property, however this is a serious miss representation of what is on offer here. Room service is limited, furnishings in the rooms are shabby and worn and the bar and restaurant are sub standard and close early. There are also no individually controlled bed reading lights in the room (being picky here - but funnily enough such a thing is a requirement of a 4 star rating, the fact the do not have them illustrates the falseness of their claims). The bathrooms are cramped and dark with low quality unbranded amenities. The location of the hotel is poor - not easily walk-able to any of the city sights or public transport, you will spend a fortune on Taxis. On a more salubrious note - the property sits right next to Rushcutters bay park - a night time 'cruising' spot for gay men - (the rustling in the bushes outside your room is most likely NOT a possum). I believe a minor Aussie celebrity was caught here 'george michael' style a year or so ago. The hotels only saving grace is the rooftop pool area which has a lovely view over the bay. It seems to me that the whole "Vibe" concept is to squeeze more money out of guests at the Toga groups inner city properties than they could by using the Travelodge brand. It is a budget experience from start to finish. Unless you are paying $110 or under.... stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy a drink? Oh you can't the bar's closed.”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were told we were only booked in for 1 night when in fact it was for 4 nights, wish we'd taken them up on the one night booking. Twice tried to get a drink in the bar before the stated closing time (10pm) only to find it closed. Door keys deactivated before end of stay; staff not really interested. Wouldn't recommend a stay there. Not suitable for the elderly or people with walking difficulties due to it's location on a steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “Purple and lime decor matches its blackened soul”
Reviews.Author: Alistair M
Reviews.Content: I have never encountered a business more cynical or staff less interested in its customers. The rooms smell of corporate, passionless design, too lazy to even make its objects work properly. The luggage carts are obstinate, the elevators misguided. In places, the patina of polycarbonate plastic has worn through, to show MDF. I'm struggling to comprehend the intended target market - and I've decided it's the terminally unlucky. They charge you $25 to use the Wifi. This hotel should never have been opened.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Dale A
Reviews.Content: Was here Halloween weekend and got a good rate for a Sydney Hotel. Wasn't in the area with all the action, but that can be a plus, too! The rooftop saltwater pool is really cool, and what a great view too! Rooms were a good size, modern, and well appointed! I reccommend Vibe and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: iloveparis0
Reviews.Content: I used to sort of like this place, but it is really getting shabby. 1) My room had an overwhelming stench of urine coming from the bathroom. 2) You need to use your room card to activate the elevator buttons, which is fine. Except that it rarely worked. The woman at reception made it seem like it was my fault. ("You must have had it next to your phone"). So make sure you don't keep your room key in the same pocket as your phone. Good luck trying to remember that throughout the course of the day. 3) The shower has no water containment system. There is a just drain in the middle of the bathroom floor, inches away from the sink. Maybe this type of setup is common in Oz (both the country and the prison), but it is no fun starting your day standing on a soggy towel to finish grooming in the bathroom mirror. Primitive. 4) I left my room at 11am for my business meetings. I placed the "Please Clean My Room" sign on my door handle. Came back at 11pm and nobody had come to clean it. Soggy towels still on the floor. Good location. The Elvis Pizzeria across the street is a fun/quirky place for lunch. But I'll be staying elsewhere next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are a bit clueless and it could use a facelift...”
Reviews.Author: YellowFox
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 5pm and waited 10 minutes while the staffed tried to contact housekeeping to see if my room was ready. I was then given keys and checked into an occupied room!!! When I came back to the lobby, they tried to send me off to a self-service apartment in a different location, saying they were fully booked!! As I refused to go, they found me a room. Interesting?? My friend had also left me a message & paid for and organized champagne for my arrival, which I never received. We complained about this twice, to be told that the staff had sent it to the wrong room. They then comp'd me a bottle of champagne for the mess up. The rooms a very small, and my bathroom smelled like mildew. Much of the paint on the basin and bathtub was peeling. Also, no top sheet on the bed - very odd. Only a light duvet. I had a park view room, but the window was obviously never cleaned from the outside and very dirty. We did enjoy the rooftop pool, and the room service food was also good. We stayed 4 days and had a few meals in the room. One other thing that was always annoying was asking for a cab - they would say the would put the light on, but often you would have to ask twice. Good location, but they need to lift there game for the money they are asking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: I was initially disappointed with the room but it got worse. The room was poorly presented and a little shabby. The sheets had stains on them and the bedding was just a synthetic duvet, which I always find uncomfortable (and I think is a lazy option for a hotel i.e. no sheets). The pillows were too soft and seemed well used to say the least and the room was very stuffy and there was no way to get fresh air in. The room was also not dark enough and I also hate that. A poor night's sleep resulted. I still can't work out why hotels don't make the comfort of the bed the highest priority. The most devastating problem however was the service from the night manager. He was rude, discourteous, incompetent and unhelpful. Here's why: I got in late from my gig (but not unreasonably late), 12:30am - and opened a bottle of wine only to discover there were no wine glasses in the room. Furthermore - no drinking glasses of any kind. I went down to reception to ask and the night manager (who took ages to get to the desk). He said he would send some glasses up to the room when he could have just walked into the dining room or bar next door and grabbed a couple for me there and then. I went back to the room and waited about 15 minutes and when they didn't arrive I called reception and got a terse, impatient response as if I should be prepared to wait and that someone was on their way. So I waited another 15 minutes - still no glasses. I called again and (get this) the night manager HANGS THE PHONE UP on me. TWICE! So I headed down to reception to see what the problem was. I had to knock loudly on the counter to get the guy to come out of the office and he was rude and confrontational virtually blaming me for the problem. This is unacceptable in my opinion and the first time I have ever been treated this way in a hotel. I won't be going back despite the day manager being apologetic in the morning and offering me some kind of deal on my next stay. There will be no next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for $99 each night”
Reviews.Author: trishymelbourne
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very modern and clean. Staff on check-in were friendly and helpful. Pleasantly surprised with Kings Cross and we loved the beautiful Rushcutters Bay. We often walked to the city which took approx 30 minutes. Occasionally we got the train back. The bar had a good atmosphere and they made the best hot chocolate. The only grip was the bed was a bit uncomfortable. Stayed previously at 5 star hotels. The Vibe Rushcutters for 1/4 of the price who can complain really.

Reviews.Title: “1 day business trip-suits it's purpose just fine”
Reviews.Author: AussieTweedFamily
Reviews.Content: Was visiting Sydney on the coin of another company due to an office products industry awards do. I would normally stay in a 5 star hotel with the family, but can say that this hotel suited me as a lone business traveller. Was close to everything I needed and got cabs to anywhere I needed by hailing one down outside. Cafes and convenience stores nearby was good for forgotten travel items! Did not eat at this hotel but did attend the cruising yacht club not far from the vibe and was a good meal. Even with a mixup at checkin, the staff were friendly and easy going. Room attendees didn't say boo to me in passing of the hallways. I had a park view which was nice but others had view of neighboring balconies which would suck unless you were interested in what your neighbors were up to! Anyway, great for business but wouldn't bring the family. Thanks for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “the vibe experience”
Reviews.Author: stanley031
Reviews.Content: good location close to park and yacht club great water views from park only minutes wak from hotel,great little restaurant in park ,we had lunch their .had dinner at bay 88 restaurant also a couple of minutes walk fom hotel ,spicey pork and fennel sauages with mashed sweet potatoes ,and vegetables.yummy.buffett breakfast was also very good at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Sydney base for sport watching”
Reviews.Author: Drew49
Reviews.Content: Good location away from but close to the city. Walk to Kings Cross Station for trains, walk to Oxford Street and Paddington, SCG and AFS. Very helpful and friendly staff, good breakfast and nice little bar. Take-away food handy as well, taxi availability good, nice walk around Rushcutters Bay. Have stayed 3 times now and will happily return. Underground carparking. Easy booking on internet, generally able to take advantage of special offers. Room was good size, bed very comfortable,plenty of staorage, just wish shower was separate from the bath!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jan S
Reviews.Content: On arrival we found the staff not too enthusiastic and they didn't provide any information on facilities, but, over our four day stay we were very happy with service we received. We booked a King room from the internet and had a good sized room with a view of both the park and main road. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and possibly the only complaint would be that the pillows were a little to soft for our liking. Initally we were a little concerned as regard to traffic and nearby rail noise but found the room to be very quiet apart from rowdy guests on one night of our stay. The location was ideal for our needs as we were visiting people locally. It was an easy and enjoyable stroll to Kings Cross and Rail Station. We were able to park the car and easily get around on Public transport. We would certainly be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scotchy1951
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from their website and got a better price than any of the booking agencies. When we arrived the service was friendly and efficient. Our room overlooked Rushcutters Bay and was huge, two bathrooms, lounge room, separate room with very comfy king bed. Both rooms had ceiling to floor windows and comfy chairs to make the most of the location. It was an easy walk to Kings Cross for a meal. The park and waterfront in front of the hotel were a fantastic place to relax after a busy day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK on the outside...”
Reviews.Author: BobaPhil
Reviews.Content: On arrival, the hotel seems very â€˜coolâ€™, although, it seemed like it was trying too hard. The staff were not overly enthusiastic at first, we had to wait for a good while (with a taxi on a meter) before I could confirm this was the hotel we needed. It wasnâ€™t a great start. The room was a good size, in need of repair though, a few of the cupboard doors were loose and there were a few stains in the wardrobe that hadnâ€™t been cleaned in a while. The bed was on wheels, which meant, during the night, I kept losing my pillow. I ended up having to wedge folded paper up the wheels to stop it from moving. The worst thing about the hotel was the noise! They have fitted blinds which are on a pulley, that takes about 2 minutes to go from open to shut and is very noisy...you can tell when your neighbours are using theirs. Also, you can hear every conversation that takes place in the hall way. We were woken up, several times, by people getting in from clubs and pubs and talking. Also, there was a group of school children staying when we were there. They got up at 5am and finally left at 7am, I heard at least two other guests tell them to shut up, since the noise was so loud. The pool was very good and the gym was easy to use and had great views. The location wasnâ€™t great, the nearest area is the â€˜famousâ€™ Kings Cross (or The Cross) in Sydney, full of late night clubs, pubs, strip clubs and brothels. We tried the breakfast one morning. The choice was good, but the food wasnâ€™t great, very dried out. And it was overly priced. Also, the internet was very overly priced! They have computers in the lobby for guests to use, which were still expensive, but not as bad. But if you want to use the net in your room, it will cost you. PROS : Good gym/pool. Close to tube station (about a 5 min walk). CONS : The noise levels. Location near Red Light District. Repair of the furniture. The moving bed. Personally, I wouldnâ€™t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average..”
Reviews.Author: callum1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 2 nights on a weekend to celebrate my birthday. We were planning to have a big night in Kings X so we needed somewhere that was close to the action but would provide us with a good nights sleep when we got back. This hotel does what it says on the packet.. it provides accomodation close to the city.. but in terms of it being a good hotel.. i wouldnt go that far. The hotel is located about a 4 minute walk to the Coke sign in the X and about 10 minutes walk to The Bourbon or Kings Cross police station. It has some fantastic cafes right on its door so i would definatley NOT pay for breakfast at the hotel! When we arrived to our room it seemed nice, but on closer inspection, there were stains everywhere.. on the armchair, carpet, bedsheet and suede bed accsesor (this would never have been washed!) bathroom was fine... You have to pay for parking.. however, we were sneaky.. we just drove into the carpark and pushed the intercom and they didnt say a thing! ##drob bags and others outside to walk in and check in and drive car down... you can save $25!## The breakfast was revolting! The eggs were like plastic, the bacon was steamed cooked, so it has a dark red colour to some and a raw look to others, they tasted like rubber, those stupid toast machines didnt work and the pastries were a joke! it is one of the worst ever breakfasts i have had at a hotel... DO NOT EAT HERE! Minibar is expensive and so is the bar downstairs.. There is a minimart right downstairs so dont drink the room water, its a rip off. Oh and the pool was lovely! But be warmed, theres only about 10 deckchairs. That said, it was cheap..ish and was very quiet despite being on a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, will come back, one issue with room...”
Reviews.Author: neartheblowhole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2000 on the first night of our honeymoon. Coming back we hoped we wouldn't spoil the memories and yes overall we really enjoyed ourselves. The room was a standard size, but very well decorated. Only minor down-er was that the room had a wet damp smell which we located the source of on one side of the bed where the carpet was absolutely soaking wet. Bit disappointed cleaning staff didn't sort this, cannot believe they wouldn't have detected it - seemed like some form of leak was causing it. However to be fair we didn't complain about it either. Hotel is in a nice location, just out of the CBD, close to Wooloomolloo with it's great restaurants. Breaky next morning was included and was great, esp the pancake maker! Will definitely stay again, but will also complain if we find a stinky, damp room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rene_e_Tati
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, near Metro, friendly staff, renewed rooms,

Reviews.Title: “good location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dekka84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vibe for a long weekend to attend a concert and enjoy Sydney. The location was good close to the park and harbor. We walked across to Watsons bay to catch the ferry into circular quay, and also walked into the city via Wooloomooloo. There is a bus stop outside the hotel for buses returning from the city. The Kings Cross station is also a short walk from the hotel, but not a good option late at night. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a bit dissapointing - but plenty of it. Rooms were a bit small and we were hoping for a view across the park to harbor - but this was not possible.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great.”
Reviews.Author: peamac
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe king room, which was roomy, comfortable and clean, as was the bathroom, with lovely, soft white towels and lots of extras. The staff are very friendly and approachable, and check-in/check-out was very quick and problem free. Although the hotel is not in the city centre, a 10 minute walk to Kings Cross station will get you into the city in no time at all. The area around the hotel has many restaurants, pubs and cafes to choose from - you definately won't go hungry. Also, near the hotel is Rushcutters Bay Park, where you can go for walks, run or just admire the many yachts and boats docked there. All in all a great, problem free, relaxing stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole great.....internet charge is a real bugbear”
Reviews.Author: 1st-on
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before whilst on holiday and now I'm travelling to Sydney a lot on business and have decided to stay there regularly. The rooms are small but comfortable, the staff friendly and the hotel has a great rooftop pool and gym and near two train stations so it's easy to get around the city. They're got to do something about their internet charge though. I travel all over the word and this is the most expensive internet charge that I've ever come across. I need (as do many business travellers) to access my emails and internet regularly and The Vibe have taken complete advantage of this by charging way over the odds - what I paid for 10 days access here is more than I pay in an entire year for my access at home!! Not good Vibe Hotels - you've really let yourselves down here. Look at this charge, apply some logic to it and cut it by 90%! You'll still make a good profit on it at the greatly reduced price.

Reviews.Title: “no customer service at all”
Reviews.Author: Lindy1986
Reviews.Content: I have written a review for a stay in February which I was celebrating my anniversary with my partner and were given 2 single beds because of being overbooked and the bedding was subject to availability.total rubbish!a response from management in tripadvisor said to contact vibe I have called the manager 4 times and left a message and has never got back to me. I have filled out 2 customer complaints form and still no response. vibe stop pretending you care about our reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: arbour
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for walking to King's Cross, the city and even the Harbour. The room was clean and affordable. Very pleasant and efficient front desk staff, especially when I found myself stuck in the lift one night. The coffee/banana bread $5.00 special is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Shariff_11
Reviews.Content: Near King cross Station which is about 5-7min away from Central. Good service. Decent amenities. Will definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a surprising location”
Reviews.Author: Kanade
Reviews.Content: Sydney has a plethora of hotels to choose from, but I picked the Vibe partly because of good experiences at the Vibe Savoy in Melbourne, but mostly because of a 40 per cent discount on Expedia. I had a decent room overlooking Bayswater Road and a little of the park. The bathroom was a bit tired but overall it was just another room. The minibar, internet connection and room service were all priced outrageously, and were not used. Something else I noticed was the main door seemed to be fairly thin, and so all the noise in the corridor could be heard in the room. What really redeemed the hotel somewhat was the location. I was concerned about staying out of the city, and in an area like Kings Cross that has such a lousy reputation. On the contrary, it was a huge plus. It was very easy to catch the train from the airport - the hotel is just a short walk from Kings Cross station, which is considered part of the city for ticket pricing purposes. Victoria St and all its restaurants is only a brisk 10-minute walk from the hotel. The city itself was only about half an hour away by foot. Finally, the Rushcutters Bay area is very nice, with the park, the harbour, and the interesting little houses and shops on the winding leafy streets. I did hire a car, and Waratah St, just around the corner, is a quiet, one-way street which had a good amount of free parking available - a 4 hour limit during the day and you could park there all night. The hotel also has a small undercover car park that costs $22 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but not close to the action”
Reviews.Author: travel471982
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine - though the staff seemed young and inexperienced and our bathroom was a little dingy. If you're looking to be right in the action, though, try another hotel (even the other vibe) closer to town. Brunch was TOTALLY overpriced - don't eat there (23 dollars per person for toast and canned fruit!? forget it.) Also, in the lobby there are pamphlets on all their locations - TAKE A BUNCH! There is two for one dinner vouchers in the back and we ate at almost every vibe we could find... dinner was good!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for us”
Reviews.Author: 4eagle
Reviews.Content: We liked the park on Sydney Harbor inlet next to this Vibe hotel. It is on bus route to Sydney city center and between the Kings Cross and Edgecliff rail stations. Rooms were nice and the staff was wonderful. It was also close to family living in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Will never be back!”
Reviews.Author: guesswho1100
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The cleaniness was non existent, mould growing on the shower curtain, cups still had coffee in them from the last guest, window was so dirty it was hard to view outside, carpet was covered in filth and bits of hair etc. Breakfast was due to be served at 630, but no staff turned up until 0707 when I started serving myself. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm sure yu can find better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - handy to airport”
Reviews.Author: JeanCBundabergQ
Reviews.Content: I had a Scoopon deal $120 night with a bottle of wine and breakfast. The wine wasn't handed over when I checked in. I assumed the bottle in the room was it. Luckily I checked first at reception and it was handed over. A guest could be slugged $25 if they opened the wine in the room because it wasn't given to them at reception. I assume reception staff keep it if the guest doesn't ask. Reception didn't tell me where the restaurant or any of the other features the hotel had so I can't comment on them, not knowing where they were. The room was very nice and fairly roomy. Nice location next to the park and handy to the airport. A shuttle bus can be arranged at reception for $15. GRIPES - even though you pay your credit card details must be handed over when booking and at reception when you check in - due to lack of soundproofing the rooms are too noisy to sleep, traffic noise keeps waking you through the night. I asked for a quiet room, It certainly wasn't that! - when a room door is open the lock beeps, that continually wakes you through the night. There seems to be no soundproofing in the halls so guests coming and going greatly disturb guests trying to sleep. - reception said breakfast was served at 6am. At 6.10 I was told to take a seat and wait. The food was out and when I said I had a plane to catch I was allowed access to the breakfast. - the breakfast was cold, the bain-marie's were not turned up hot enough. I wonder about the health implications of this. There was a great choice of breakfast, even a machine that makes pancakes, pity it was ruined by most of it being cold. - three plates I picked up were dirty. You could feel crud sticking to them. The top plate had crumbs on it so I picked underneath, all plates were dirty. - there was black floaties in the orange juice. The restaurant was nice with views to the park and it was lovely in the evening seeing the walkers in the park. I felt quite safe during the day but wonder how safe it would be at night. A feedback form from the room was sent to the company and no response was received about my review.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Miricle
Reviews.Content: The staff were very professional and friendly, love the location surrounded by rushcutters park. Room was very clean and spacious. Even though the restaurant at breakfast was very busy, the host ( i think his name was Dan) was super friendly and helpful and was able to get me a table promptly. Would defiantly stay again when in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, but.................”
Reviews.Author: WizardMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vibe Hotel Rushcutters Bay first week June for 2 nights. Managed to get a "Special" room, breakfast and car parking and for the price paid, considered this value for money. If I had to pay for breakfast and parking, then in my opion there are better options. If arriving by car from Sydney city and travelling through the William Street tunnel, you have an immediate and dangerous situation in having to drive across three lanes of traffic on your left to get to the hotel entrance and car park, miss this entrance and you have quite a trip before being able to do a U turn and return. I found it better to stay on my right out of the tunnel, turn right, right again and right again and cross the busy road with the aid of traffic lights into the hotel entrance. Check in was quick and painless, but on presenting my credit card was advised there was a credit card surcharge. Having been involved in the hotel industry for many years I am well aware hotel managements around the world include credit cards fees in their costs and overheads and this surchage is just a blatent grab for extra turnover. My room was X01, clean, with expected amenities, good size bed and more than satisfactory, however room (s) ending in 01 abut the lift well and once the TV is turned off and trying to sleep you can hear the steady whine of a lift moving up and down the lift shaft. It is not overly loud, but loud enought to encroach on sleeping. Corridor noise is loud however and other guests seem to enjoy making noise as they head to their room, slamming doors as they go. Buffet breakfast was good both mornings, ample hot and cold choices, pleasant suroundings, morning paper available at front counter (no cost). Parking under the hotel, press the buzzer and you are let in. Check out, oh so slow, just one staff person at the counter at 8am dealing with a picky customer checking every detail on their account, took about 15 minutes, surley at this time of day, must be peak check out time, more staff could be allocated. Staff very friendly and eager to assist. Conclusion: Nice hotel, not very convieniant to Sydney city and not close to anything. Kings Cross is a steep up hill walk taking about 15 minutes. Taking the car has the problems of finding car parking space or paying high parking fees, or a taxi, with the high costs associated with them. A good value package deal may make this hotel worth while, but if having to pay for extras ( breakfast and parking) there are perhaps better options. And avoid a room ending in 01, there may be other rooms around the lift well, so ask for a room away from the lifts for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel with the world's most expensive chocolate bar!”
Reviews.Author: Brocko25
Reviews.Content: If you get a cheap rate as I did, why not. Just over $100 a night for a large room with a deep bathtub, oversized bathroom, rubbish cable, and decent bed. Oh, and a view over a busy road. This isnt the place for a relaxing, luxurious or romantic evening! But it serves its purpose as an average clean hotel. The minibar is basic, with a small cadbury chocolate bar available for $7.50! I didnt want it, but it did serve as a source of amusement. Room service is avail 24 hours. Cable TV consists of a couple of news and sport channels. I have more channels at home! Staff were all friendly and courteous, I exchanged some jokes with Queenie upon checkin. I was awoken early each morning - by the loud air conditioning and on two occasions, and the mobile phone alarm vibrating on the bedside table in the room next door also. So sleep quality was definately not great. Given the large number of decent hotels in the area, I would probably choose a hotel up the hill next time to save the hike in the morning. But it was good value for the price I paid, for sure

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Kankou
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and 2 small children and stayed for 2 weeks. Upon check in we were not offered any help with luggage, prams etc. Try getting 2 small children out of a taxi and thru your stupid doors. It wasnt busy and 3 people were standing behind the counter watching us and chatting to each other and continued to carry on with their conversation making me feel like I was interupting them so much that I heard there conversation about how one of them having their brother come and live with them and dadada....rude and ignorant. We were finally checked what we thought was a junior sweet but was basically 2 rooms with a door in between propped open with chairs. On one occasion I had the adjoining door close on my 2 children under 3 years and had to go to reception and get another key to get them out. We had booked a childrens package.....not what I had expected. Pool was out of service, gym was pathetic.....really. The lift drove me insane....I was their for business and needed to come and go in a hurry....good luck. The driveway was a pain in the butt. Couldnt hear anything that the receptionist were saying due to the traffic noise.....Not clear as to which button to push to gain entry or exit. (make a sign its not hard) Everything was too difficult for staff members and I didnt meet one that actually tried to engage to help. 1 morning out of the 14 we stayed the children were offered a high chair.....I think you need to seriously review your staff. If they dont care then they shouldnt be employed. Your main problem is inconsistency. Oh also when you have raving lunatic in the room next door and call reception at 3 am you expect something to be done about it.....well looks like you suffered the results of poor service becuase i noticed youy had the maintanence people in the next morning........ I speak from experience having managed and lectured around the world in the hotel business....I would have put far more effort into this review but I am just matching your attitude to the industry which I am afraid is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid. I highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bannawk
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful attentive staff, clean, quirky but charming decor. You won't be disappointed. Perfect location near parks and waterfront. You can easily walk to nightlife and restaurants or just stroll in the adjacent beautiful park. Several good restaurants literally next door, as well as a couple Pubs. Cabs and busses are right out front. If you've never been to Sydney, start here - you'll be glad you picked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Essentially a good hotel, but avoid breakfast, mini bar, laundry and key cards do not work”
Reviews.Author: PhilExport
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel, and whilst I was on business, I would have liked to try another hotel, but the Vibe was the cheapest on Tripadvisor. Location is good and in hindsight it was a good move. On the plus side, the rooms are fine. It is best to get a park-view room, if not, your room will face some residential apartments which are so close you have no privacy. I did book a park-view room but was not given one, which was rather frustrating, so I rang down to reception and they moved me. The choice of TV channels is good, with a few sports channels like Fox thrown in. There are complimentary newspapers. When you ask for a taxi, the reception click a light on outside the hotel, and because it is on a main thoroughfare, I never waited more than 2 minutes for a taxi. Here is how I think Vibe can improve; 1. Breakfast - $28 for a full buffet breakfast. Sorry but a canteen style breakfast with limited choice and staff who barely speak English (and do not understand "Brown sauce"!!), lack of cutlery and having to stand around like a plum while your cereal goes soggy waiting for a spoon, is NOT acceptable. Go to the Bay 88 cafe about 50 yards up the hill - typical Sydney cafe, outdoor living etc etc, good menu. I had toast, coffee and a bacon and sausage roll for $15.50. 2. Laundry - I fully expect to pay a bit extra if I am just going to bag up the laundry and leave it on the bed for the hotel to organise. However, I weighed up what I needed to be done, and I would have paid $100. When walking up to Fitness First (in Kings Cross), I kept my eyes peeled for a launderette. There is one about 150 yards up the hill on the right hand side. Very friendly service - all for $19. Yes, nineteen. I understand profit makes the world go round, but not extortion. 3. Mini bar prices are scandalous. I had one chocolate bar and then went to the 7-11 which is about 30 yards up the hill. So for all the things that the hotel are trying to rip off their customers for, their is a perfectly adequate (for breakfast, much better), alternative within a stone's throw away. I do not the Vibe has such a frivolous clientele who are just willing to pay those prices without giving it a second thought. If there were in the middle of the outback then they have a captive market. Where they are located, they don't. Guests should wise up and not use these services, the hotel would soon reduce their prices. My other comments are that the key card system simply doesn't work, neither in the lift nor in the room door slot. Also the fact that I believe there are not enough front desk staff means that you can queue for 5 minutes just to get your card reset. This is frustrating to say the least. I wanted to go to the rooftop pool but there was some fashion shoot going on, so it was all closed off. A bit disappointing as it was my only slot that I could go up there and have a relax. The view looks great and the area seems nice. Shame the hotel choose to cash in at the expense of their guests. The gym is OK, also on the rooftop. There are about 4 machines from memory. I went to the fitness first which is in Kings Cross and about 10 minutes walk away. $22 for a casual visit, but excellent facilities including steam room. No pool. I hope the hotel finds these comments constructive. I do like the hotel, but I sincerely hope they take the pricing comments on board, because no-one likes to be ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Long way out !”
Reviews.Author: SimonWise
Reviews.Content: One of several Vibe hotels and the best I think. Nice rooms. Staff seemed a bit inexperienced on the front desk but no problem with that - they seemed willing enough. Pool are on teh roof is nice with a small gym. Can't comment on teh gym as it was closed on my visit with what looked like police tape sealing off the area - Not sure who died.Shame there was no provision for another facility. The most notable feature with this hotel is its location on Rushcutters bay. Very nice spot for a stroll but a long uphill walk to Kings X station and not one to attempt with bags unless you want to walk off a few pounds or the gym isn't open but there's always a taxi waiting outside the front door for the lame or the sane. There's a couple of restaurants close by but thr main choices are up that hill to Kings X. Would rate this hotel higher except for the location... and thats difficult to fix.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: golfer45Scotland
Reviews.Content: We visited Sydney for 8 nights and were booked into the Hotel by a third party as a luxury 4 star hotel........ Not in my opinion...some of the staff were brilliant especially the girl on the first morning we arrived 24th Feb 7.30am in the restaurant.. I dont know her name dark hair tied in a pony tail but she was so helpful and very very friendly and one of the guys in there too but cant remember his name either but he was from the uk again very friendly and made us feel very welcome...advised on transport, trains and where to visit etc, a couple of the reception girls leave a lot to be desired We arrived at 7am in the morning following 28 hour travel from Edinburgh uk and although i was aware we propbably would have to wait for a room i did not anticipate what would happen !!!! and were more bothered about what they looked like and ordering lunch!!!. I asked what time the room would be ready to be told mmmmm 2pm it states there!! she did say she would get that room done first if she could but hotel was full and couldnt promise.. She told us to come back at 12 noon. They kept our cases and we were able to go to pool on the roof and use the restaurant and she would call when our room was ready>>>>>>>>>> still waiting for that call!!!!! The hotel is a long way out from the centre and is in a very quiet location with not a lot going on round and about.apart from red light area in Kings cross which we avoided...... The hotel is about a 10 min walk uphill to both Kings cross station and 10 mins the other way to edgecliffe station although uphill an easier walk. The buses stop right outside the hotel and run very reg to Circular quay which we found was the best option.... The hotel has a limited menu for dinner and be warned if there is a wedding on you cannot use either restaurant or the bar which was very annoying!!!!! The hotel is also used for flight crews who seem to take over the whole upstairs pool area for their pool parties and I felt so sorry for the guy that looks after this area... One morning I went up to roof and the place was a disgrace towels left all over the floor and in the pool, bottles glasses everywhere (even though it states no glasses on the roof) and all the chairs and loungers pulled to one side !!!!!!! would definately not stay here again for a holiday but hotel is nice enough for short breaks The manager was nice and helpful too when we had a problem with our return flights ( he let me use his comp on the desk to try and sort it) but just not for me too far out from the centre and excitement of Sydney. If you want to be away from everything then this is the hotel for you with a marina close by and a lovely park....

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: SMRFET
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel - no concierge Came to the reception - the staff were mumbling and demanded 100 dollars without even explaining what it was for !!!! Room - arrive at room and the keys don't work. My husband went down to reception and the staff member came back to the room with him let us in and told us that we had to resolve the issue with reception in the morning - too bad if we wanted to go out !!! In the room wardrobes damaged bathroom was not cleaned. We had only one towel to share. Advised housekeeping but after 3 attempts still no additional towel. Parking - terrible. We were told to leave the keys and they would park it only to find the car still in the same spot we left it the day before !!! When I asked why it was there no one could explain it to me. They advised me they would move it straight away. I came back 2 hours later and it was still there. On top of this they put valet parking on my bill !! Roomservice - we ordered easiest thing on the menu a ham and cheese toasted sandwich. It arrived over an hour after it was ordered and it was really cold. Looking at the sandwiches they were not even toasted. Parking - we handed over We only stayed cause we had to for a weddingand had prepaid. I would not recommend it even if you're desperate

Reviews.Title: “Great service from Reception”
Reviews.Author: buffie46
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 1 night (for our Wedding Anniversary) I phoned the hotel before arriving to ask if there was a possibility of an upgrade to a parkview room & spoke with Caleb, he was very helpful & said to mention that I had called when I arrived. We were put in a parkview room which was nice for us to have a view while we drank our bottle of Anniversary Champagne. We did notice that the fridge wasn't cold so called reception who sent a serviceman up but he said it WOULD get cold, just as well we had an Esky with ice because the fridge still wasn't cold the next morning. Breakfast was OK except I asked for 1 fried egg easy over & received 2 fried eggs so overcooked they were like rubber.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again or recommend this hotel to friends or family”
Reviews.Author: FeeJaySydney
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed in this hotel - we were really looking forward to a night way with friends and it was spoilt. I made the booking about 3 months ago - booked a King room. When we arrived to check in - waited over 30 mins as it was very busy - we were told that as the hotel was full we were now in a room with 2 single beds. OK we thought - we can move them together - no so - they were fixed in place to the wall. But the best was yet to come - when we went to the room and started to unpack we found personal items that were not ours and clothes in the wardrobe! We collected our belongings and went straight to reception - all we got was a look of surprise from the person there who advised that according to the computer the room was empty. We were moved to another room - still single beds. In addition to this, we also found out - by reading signs at the lift, that the hotel restaurant and bar were closed that evening due to a wedding. We were not told this by reception earlier in the week when we rang to confirm our booking or at check in. So much for our planned quiet drink at the bar and then dinner. On top of all this - the lifts are hopeless - many times we stood on our floor wating while the lift passed by without stopping - we resorted to the stairwell a few times. We also had trouble with our room swipe card - we had to have it reset twice and our friends also had to have theirs reset a number of times. The buffet breakfast was limited - not a great variety to chose from. When it came time to check out we were charged for parking which had been told at check in was free - we did not have to pay in the end but our friends were charged. Clearly the hotel staff and systems were not able to cope with the number of quests that night and changes need to happen. I will not be back to find out if this happens.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: This weekend my partner and I stayed at the Vibe Hotel for some relaxation. It took what seemed like forever to get this hotel, the traffic was pretty bad. My partner and I drove into the hotel driveway and parked the car to the side and I went to check in. Upon arrival I was attended by a staff member named Sarah. Sarah was initially pleasant, but during the whole time did not seem to be listening to a word that I said. This was quite obvious when she only gave me one door key! She did not even tell me when check out was or where breakfast was. Those little things that I always get told when I usually get checked into hotels. We even had the greatest luck in having her check us out too and at no instance did she ask us how our stay was or seemed like she cared. We did however did get told to "Have a nice day". When I went back to our car that was still parked in the driveway, I asked my partner why we were not given parking assistance yet. My partner advised that he was asked to park behind this other car and wait. So we waited and waited.. until I decided to ask the concierge what was going on. He asked if I had checked in and I told him yes. He said that we could now proceed to the car park. A bit late for that information. He also forgot to advise that we need a parking ticket/slip to put on our car, because if we did not do so, the hotel could tow away our car. We were also told that there would be plenty of parking when we come back to park the car later than night. Later that night the car park was FULL! Luckily there was one car that pulled out. The car park has two sections for parking. The other section was for some other special parkers. This then meant there really was not much parking available. This was evident that night when you saw people doing "make shift" parking everywhere! (DIY Parking is $22) We got assigned to a quiet room as we requested (probably the one thing they got right) on the third floor. The hotel looked aesthetically pleasing. Our room was of decent size. The view was odd, our view looked straight in some person's apartment. The bed was comfortable. The room had a decent sized flat screen television with a good selectionof channels. The room also appeared clean. The biggest failure of this hotel room was the bathroom! The bathroom was horrible. It was small and badly designed. The shower had not boundary around it, it's boundary consisted of just a shower curtain. The shower had a plastic chair in it! The shower had mould on the floor corners and on the shower curtain. The bathroom sink was so close to shower curtain that it was rather squashy. The shower was dysfunctional and when you showered the water would spray everywhere and by the end of your shower, the whole bathroom floor was wet and it resembled a lake. The shower curtain did nothing. The air conditioning in the room was pretty poor. It at times did not feel like it was working. It felt quite warm at times and the controls panel on the wall seemed like it was pressed so many times that it was hard to make it work. It was actually cooler in the hotel corridor than our room, even though I had put the air conditioning down to 15 degrees. The surrounding areas of the hotel are nice. There is a beautiful Rushcutters Bay Park next door that has water views of boats. The hotel is also a very short walk to Potts Point, which is great for food and shopping. The buffet breakfast was probably the best thing out of the whole experience. The staff there, particularly this nice Asian man were attentive and pleasant. The breakfast was nice. The usual culprits, toast (of many varieties), bacon, eggs, etc. The coffee was freshly brewed too. In the end I am glad that i only paid $120 to stay here. Thanks goodness I had a good deal, otherwise paying anymore to stay here would not have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Vibe”
Reviews.Author: RFBoston
Reviews.Content: I agree with another post - take the hotel if you get a deal. Don't pay top dollar. Maybe in its heyday, it was a hip boutique hotel but its far from it now. After a quick check in, we were interrupted twice by other guests that were also booked into our room. Called the front desk the first time and it still happened. Both had key cards and walked right in. The mattress was horrible. After the first night we switched to a room on the 5th floor and it was fine. We got stuck in elevator # 1 for a hour! The manager assured us the repair team was not far away but after i got fed up and pried the doors open myself. The manager left a nice note of apology and comped our breakfast for 5 nights but at checkout, the breakfast charge was on the bill! The breakfast is below average and not worth the charge. The public areas are tired and worn. Needs a major revamp. Its a property where the owners are milking it without improving and maintaining the hotel. This combined with management dropping the ball a few times gave me a overall negative experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss - don't pay top dollar”
Reviews.Author: happiestcamper000
Reviews.Content: Paid a fortune for a room over NYE. Had one thing after another go wrong from the moment we got there, from room service taking well over an hour (and forgetting food items) to having to wait at the bar for nearly 15 minutes to be served as it was unattended, to having to repeatedly push the carpark door buzzer (for over five minutes!!) waiting for someone to let us in, rollaway bed was unusable and the story goes on.
