Complained to staff who were extremely understanding and helpful. Eventually the Assistant Manager (Saxon I think) stepped in and upgraded us to a lovely room - he was extremely professional and polite and essentially saved our experience at the hotel. If i owned a hotel i'd hire him! Cleaning staff were also very good. Hotel getting a bit dated and could do with a refurb. Rooftop pool was a huge + and very nice. Would only recommend if a cheap deal.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for location”
Reviews.Author: debrakpage
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with ok sized rooms and bathroom, nice rooftop pool but not enough sunloungers. Was VERY expensive on New years eve for location (would NEVER stay in Kings cross again).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Interesting Location”
Reviews.Author: ponyclubber
Reviews.Content: Really nice simple hotel. Everything done without fuss, clean and with helpful staff. Pool up on the roof is lovely and there is a lovely cafe set in the park by Rushcutters bay where you can go watch the wildlife and the affluant locals. If you like your city visits with a little bit more edge the kings cross is for you. Expensive to eat and drink out side of Happy Hours but this seems to be true for the whole of Sydney. Breakfast was really expensive so we didn't bother and the hotel did seem to be quite geared towards business but this didn't detract from our enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Price does not reflect quality”
Reviews.Author: Geoff J
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and staff were courteous but that's were it ended. We stayed on a Saturday night so paid the higher rate of 370.00 with Breakfast included Went downstairs for cocktail before heading out , sorry no cocktails , wanted a swim sorry pool closed , TV in room did not work. Breakfast quality average and rooms small I really think Australian hotels need to get with the program , they will continue to lose their local tourist to the overseas market when they provide such poor value for money. You cannot charge full rate even in peak season when there is work going on in the hotel and you cannot use the facilities that you are paying for. If that is the standard of all Vibes , will not be going back again

Reviews.Title: “no vibe”
Reviews.Author: Sofi14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is need of a makeover ....very tired. Windows don't open, felt stuffy. We had a inter connecting door in our room & thru this could hear everything happening next door including snoring . The only thing going for it is location.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely worth it - I would stay again without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: leetoki
Reviews.Content: I got our King Standard room through an online deal which included breakfast for two and stayed three nights. The room was beautifully clean and while the view was not what you would call picturesque (facing an apartment building and train tracks across the road) the partner and I actually found ourselves quite entranced watching the bustle of Sydney from our peaceful little nook. The room itself looks quite small but that could be due to the bed - Oh the bed! Being a king size, it looks wider than it is long and was an absoloute dream to sleep on - a real plus if you don't like travelling or miss your bed. We struggled not to sleep in every day, just for how comfy it was! The bathroom was clean and modern and featured a shower and bath in one with good strong hot water, and the usual little hotel toiletries. A plus was the Room Service - food was basically the same price as eating at the Curve resturaunt so being the lazy cats we are, we ate in most nights and were called 'Miss' and "Mr' respectfully by all staff, which is a treat when you are twenty. All staff members were prompt, cheerful but also pleasantly casual which suited the hotel well. The rooftop pool has a beautiful view (there is also a very nice gym if you are inclined) and is a great novelty. The buffet breakfast was on par with every hotel I've been to so no complaints there. I would definetely stay again - for a decent price you get a nice, clean hotel that makes you at ease in an excellent location on the outskirts of Kings Cross. I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a hotel in Sydney near CBD and had...”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPaul
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel in Sydney near CBD and had stayed at the Vibe about 5 years ago. Many hotels were sold out and Vibe was charging $250 for the night. Rooms were tired, furniture old and items needed maintenance (shower door was broken, window screens ripped and dirty, carpet dirty, doors/walls needed new paint). Bed was old and pillows were either overly large or completely flat. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Rooftop Pool”
Reviews.Author: FCTravel006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, and it has nice appliances, and a nice TV in room. The bathroom is energy efficient, and well illuminated and clean Pool was great, salt water, being in the roof of the hotel has a great view of rushcutters bay hotel very close to kings cross subway station, and buses can be picked up across the street or one street over depending what part of the city you go. Internet computer in lobby works on coins, good for a quick log in would totally stay there if visiting Sydney again. The location is perfect, very nice area next to park and transportation, with many restaurants within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Decently priced, nice pool with view, but would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: lil_calgary_woman
Reviews.Content: They advertise rooms with a view, and we paid for one, but do not be mistaken, there is not! The hotel faces the motor way and even though it is beside a park / marina, only a few rooms will see this, or corners of it. The only view is from the pool area, which is admittedly really nice (see attached picture). We've stayed at other Vibe hotels as they tend to be very trendy and a great atmosphere, but this one not so much. They have tried and I'll give them that, but the building and rooms are in need of an up-do. The bathroom was renovated and nice, and the bed very trendy and comfortable, but the rest a bit old. Room was so-so clean, but the housekeeping tidied it up the second night, without asking. Housekeeping was very friendly. The front desk staff didn't seem thrilled to be there either day or any time we visited. Not rude, but disinterested and seemed a bit annoyed when asked questions. Our biggest complaint was the location, only about 5 blocks from the red light district, although admittedly it doesn't run over. If you take the train home though, you will have to walk through it to get back to the hotel. This hotel is not good for children!! Parking is horrendous. Underground and secure, but very tight (which I hear is common for Sydney) and way over-priced. It was over $25 a night to park although on their website and in the room even they advertise less. Internet was $12.50 an hour or $25 for 24 hours I believe. Food is very expensive and no where's close by to eat unless willing to dine in the red-light district.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Down_Under01
Reviews.Content: A very big complex close to the water and a 10 minute walk to King's Cross shopping area. Somewhat busy, but the reception staff work hard to get through the morning rush and are very courteous. My room was clean and modern, and smoke free. Standard hotel breakfast selections, plentiful and fresh. Good evening meals and I was delighted by the personalised service when the chef came out to speak with me regarding a food allergy - very thoughtful. Free though limited wireless internet connection which was great. Many Australian hotels charge outrageous daily connection fees, so thanks "Vibe". I would definitely stay here again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay..”
Reviews.Author: bizzbuff
Reviews.Content: We were happy with the location of the hotel. It is not right in the heart of all the city hustle and bustle so you will need a cab to get to see the popular sights of Sydney. The cab rides were not expensive, less than $20.00 AU to get to any of the sights. The pool is on the roof, and we would have used it if the weather had been a bit warmer. The room was clean, and the staff was helpful. The restaurant had good food, and wasn't too crowded. The only suggestion I would make to the management, would be to have wireless internet in the rooms. We had to get a cable from the desk, and at $24.95 a day for internet, it would be nice not to be tied to the desk. All in all it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.......and this was cheap.”
Reviews.Author: LouisCypher
Reviews.Content: Great location. But Grubby and worn . Shocking bed. Damaged unusable single chair in room. Parking fees not disclosed unless enquired about ; ridiculous internet tariff And then there's the breakfast. I've been vaccuuming my mind trying to think of a worse breakfast, anywhere, anytime , any continent. No luck! This one gets the gong. Appalling - cold rubber eggs , plastic toast , long extinct cereal , red things masquerading as tomatoes, doggie dodo sausages , coffee to die for (literally). The Restaurant Manager should visit Vibe Sydney for breakfast to see how it should be done. We won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can get it for a good rate”
Reviews.Author: hollyjoy7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special but if you can get it for a good price then it is worth it. Try to get rate with the breakfast included as it is a full breakfast (hot and cold) and there aren't many other breakfast restaurants around. The view from the roof is beautiful as you can see Rushcutter Bay but most views from the rooms are nothing special. The staff was helpful but internet was expensive at $2.00 for 20 minutes. A bus stop is just across the street and there is also a delicious pizza restaurant across the xtreet (not Elvis pizza). Overall a decent place that isn't in the middle of things but yet not too far away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: countrycreature
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, after reading reviews on here I was apprehensive about our stay at Vibe. A friend in Sydney had booked us in as it was close to his house and we would be spending a fair bit of time with his family. Well I am happy to report that our stay here was great. We experienced none of the problems previous reviewers had. Our check in was smooth and fast, the room was clean - we were in a junior suite which had plenty of room - and the bed was really comfortable! I was worried about noise levels as I'm a very light sleeper but sleeping here was bliss, no noise and excellent block out blinds so I could even have an afternoon nanna nap. There was no top sheet on our bed and one was put on without fuss as soon as we asked. We didn't find it necessary to eat at the hotel as there is an abundance of excellent cafes and restaurants within short walking distance from the hotel. We enjoyed eating out for every meal. My partner did have breakfast at curves one morning and said it was pretty average and overpriced. But with so many excellent places to eat nearby this was not a problem. The location is excellent. Rushcutters Bay is beautiful and the hotel sits right on a lovely park. We walked through this gorgeous park many times to visit our friends living nearby. If you walk to Kings Cross from the restaurant you may come across a small cafe called Uliveto - we had breakfast here almost daily. AMAZING! There are just so many great places nearby Darlinghurst, Potts Point (great for a girl to get pampered with lots of hair and beauty salons) Kings Cross and if you keep walking down Darlinghurst road the shops on Oxford street aren't that far away. We had a really great stay at Vibe Rushcutters - the staff were all really helpful and friendly - especially the cleaning staff. Thanks for making our stay a memorable one (it was a very rare time for us to get away without the kids).

Reviews.Title: “Time for Change”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodau
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before on business but this time around was checked in by family for a weekend away. The place is starting to look shabby. Corridor carpets are in poor condition, 'art' on the walls was stained and ripped on our floor. Rooms are serviceable but small. No glassware for wine in fridge. Called to reception and they arrived ... 20 minutes later! Smoke from other guest rooms on sixth floor wafting into ours. Advised management of this and told "it happens some times". Service at front desk slow and far from greeting. Parkview Room was $195/night. Sure, you could see the park but also could see/hear the train line. Over-priced. Seems to be attracting a certain audience now. Our floor was alive to the sound of drunken chanting and cheering in the early hours of the morning. If you're on business travel, need a solution and it's on expenses, go for it. If you're on a weekend away and want to relax, don't do it to yourself. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel if the location suits”
Reviews.Author: further40
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are not large but they are refurbished and are clean and comfortable. The black out blinds work well. There is nothing much in the immediate location of this hotel. There was no help with suitcases on arrival. We did not receive the first wake up call we had requested. We mentioned this when we requested the second but this did not materialise either.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right, just needs some tweaking.”
Reviews.Author: caf54
Reviews.Content: The Vibe is a comfortable hotel that offers very reasonable advance booking rates. It is not a luxury hotel, and it is due for some rehab. Still, for the price and location near Darlinghurst and King's Cross, and not far from the city center, it fills the bill. We found the bed to be very comfortable. To ensure a good night's rest, ask for a room that doesn't face the main street (Bayswater Road).

Reviews.Title: “A little dissappointed...”
Reviews.Author: AquaQld
Reviews.Content: I, and many other family members, stayed at the Vibe for 4 nights. The location is great, walking distance to the city if you enjoy a walk. The first day there we had a staff member walk in to the room unannounced. She was apologetic, wanted to check to loo paper supplies she said, and insisted on looking even when we told her we had plenty. The magnetic keys for lifts and room entry are a complete disaster. They need to look into this. I had mine changed 3 times in the 4 days we were there. It's very annoying to get up to your room and then to have to go back to reception because you can't open the door! Breakfast was very ordinary, I had a problem with the powered scrambled eggs and cold bacon. Two mornings I had to ask for the tea bags I wanted, as the container was empty. The staff need to be more attentive. I sat through breakfast one morning looking at a spill on the floor. It was still there when I left. The room was okay, just another hotel room with nothing different to remember it by. Good bed and lots of hot water in the shower! We had no water glasses though and they tried to charge us for water, wine and chocloate bars that we had not touched when we checked out. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay there again, there are many other hotels in Sydney to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff, faulty equipment, tiny rooms, and 90's decor--don't bother with the Vibe”
Reviews.Author: madamo01
Reviews.Content: The Vibe wants to be a trendy boutique hotel but it is more akin to a low-rent, characterless business motel. The location in Rushcutters is good, but don't expect much from the hotel. We discoverd the following on our recent visit: 1) Poor service: inattentive and uninformed staff. For ex., it took over an hour and 3 calls to Guest Services to get someone up to make up the sofa bed for our kids who were desperate for sleep. 2) Rubbish lifts: So bad long queues would form as people struggled to get to their floors. 3) Shoddy Keys: We had to have our magnetic keys replaced 5 times in the course of our 2 night stay. Invariably we would get all the way up to the room with 3 tired kids to discover that the key wouldn't open the door. Other guests were having the same problem. 4) 90's Decor: the place needs a total refurbishment. The rooms lack any warmth whatsoever. Our 'Junior Suite' looked like it was decorated in 1990's IKEA office furniture. 5) Tiny Rooms: Our Junior suite was comprised of two adjoining rooms which combined would be smaller than most double rooms in Sydney hotels. For ex., when the small sofa bed was pulled out it abutted the dresser. To get to the toilet we had to climb over the bed or fold it half way up. 6) Extra Charges: $30 for internet per day, $22 for parking, and a surcharge of 1.5% if you want to use your credit card to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & good service”
Reviews.Author: fridaytraveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay started a bit rough because our reservation and email stating there were 3 of us in 1 room was lost. It was instantly taken care of. The room only had 1 double bed so they immediately brought a roll away, which was quite comfy, after we called. Her name escapes me and I apologize, front desk, morning gal, blond, young, very sweet and always smiling and so helpful. Got all of our day trips arranged for us. They were all top nothc trips and picked us up exactly on time. Location of the hotel seemed a bit sketchy at first but we soon realized a short walk got us to public transportation and some very good restaurants. Overall it was a good value hotel with very good service and extremely accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Attention required”
Reviews.Author: andyoz
Reviews.Content: I have again returned to this hotel, the rooms albeit small and basic are extremely clean, quiet and comfortable. I have a gripe with the food and beverage service. For my entire stay (4 days) the restaurant and bar was closed from 6pm due to private functions, but a notice in the elevator did state that regular room service was still available (more on that soon). Firstly this didn't bother me personally as I had no intention of using the bar or restaurant for dinner but I am 1 of maybe 200 plus rooms who may have. Is it more incentive for this hotel to hire out the restaurant to outsiders (they were not house guests, I chatted to some of them) than to cater for in house guests? I did order room service twice during my stay and both fairly late at night, however alhough the food was good there were some let downs. First night ordered Butter Chicken served with rice, Indian bread and pappadums $21.50 plus $3 tray delivery. Twenty minutes after placing my order I get a call saying they had run out of rice, would I like extra bread? Tray is delivered, signed for then I realise no cutlery. Call room service and cutlery is delivered. No pappadums! Next night order spicy wedges with sour cream and sweet chilli sauce. Tray arrives, sign for it, realise it's a plate of wedges but no sour cream/chilli sauce, or cutlery. Call again, pot of sour cream/chilli sauce/cutlery delivered. Not much apology offered. $10.50 plus $3 tray delivery. Went for breakfast in the morning, sign says please wait to be seated. I waited, chirpy waitress takes my room number to bill and says sit anywhere. Well I tried but all tables were full. Walked around again and walked out. Knowing I had been billed I tried 30 minutes later and secured a table left by previous diners. Their used plates were still on the table, eventually cleared but no replacement of a fresh setting. I try to make the table look occupied using what I had, go to get self service juice, coffee and fresh cutlery to return and find my table occupied by other people who had obviously been told to "sit anywhere". I told them I had that table and they moved on looking for somewhere else to sit. In summary, breakfast is completely chaotic and disorganised. Not a recommended place for a relaxed sunday breakfast, and on top of that the food is pretty average. Bulk cooked tasteless scrambled eggs, soggy bacon, trust me I waited for the fresh tray and that was bad, roasted tomatos that could have done with another 30 mins in the oven, tinned baked beans, VERY stale croissants and absolutely no coordination in seating/clearing tables. Fresh fruit was available but the melon cut very thin and the pineapple so unripe they should have considered tinned instead. Room Service...well someone really needs to look at this, especially when there is an extra charge for it. How can a tray go out of the kitchen without someone noticing items missing, especially cutlery, twice!! Besides that it's a good hotel, fits the medium between top and lower. Please look at your F&B, it used to be pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Death to Doonas in Australia”
Reviews.Author: WollongongSheila
Reviews.Content: Why do hotels in Australia insist on doonas in summer or any time really? They are just UNNECESSARY in this climate. The vibe only provides a thin doona and three thin pillows per bed. The bed is the most important thing isn't it? The doona may explain the air con being set at 15 degrees. Hardly eco friendly! Can't a hotel at $170 AUD at least provide a top sheet and perhaps a light cotton blanket in the wardrobe? The average Aussie bloke mightn't mind sleeping sans anything but most people would expect the bed to have useable manchester, right? The cover could come off the doona and be used alone but who want to mess with that at 2:00 a.m. after a big night? Oh, and Vibe, has management actually smelt that moisturiser you provide, perhaps it has some of the pool water in it?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for New Year's Eve, all you need after a big night out!”
Reviews.Author: rachelopps
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on New Year's Eve. This was one of the few hotels who would allow a booking for one night over New Year. We just wanted a city crash pad. This was ideally located near the park we watched the New Year's fireworks in with a picnic. It's very near Paddington so there is plenty to do and a cab ride to Circular Quay only took 15 minutes (and it was busy!). The rooms are ok. It's a bit like an upmarket Travelodge. It seemed clean though and the rate was very reasonable. They have valet parking and the staff seemed efficient. I did hear one lady as I checked out, complaining about cockroaches in her room but hey, this is Australia! (and she was British). Recommended if you want a cheap, no-frills convenient hotel in Sydney. Ideal for New Year's Eve when you are spending most of the time out and about anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, good location & hotel facilities”
Reviews.Author: kmrej
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights incl NYE and found the rooms to be really comfortable & the rooftop pool and gym to be excellent. We were rarely around during the day but enjoyed the sunsets by the pool on a couple of occasions. This is a very functional hotel just outside the CBD and was reasonable value for money as result. We found the staff to be helpful but not over-friendly & our key-cards for the lift worked fine! Absolutely nothing to complain about here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but”
Reviews.Author: undercoverelephant
Reviews.Content: Ok, good points. Close to the Metro stops of Kings cross or Edgecliff. Good location next to Rushcutters Bay. Functional room and bathroom. Good Gym and pool area (if you are quick) Bad Points. Rude and unfriendly girl receptionist, who did not know Sydney and had to refer every question to the back office. Hoovering on three occasions pre 8 am outside of my room. Dirty floors in lift, pool area not maintained during the day. Thin walls between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not Staying here Again”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastGretel
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Monday this being our first break in 4 years and wanted to catch up with old friends and be in an area easy for us to do so. The room was musty and as I booked a parkview I expected to see the whole park not just a patch of grass and the train station. I was shown another room which was better, on the same floor but then they wanted an extra $150 per night - no point. As I had paid in advance for the 3 nights we were in Sydney I really had no choice but to stay where I was. The tea and coffee portions were sparce, room service the burger was a rip off and meat tasteless. On departure, water from the mini bar was on my bill, I asked for it to be removed as I did not drink it I just placed it next to the fridge due to no real milk being supplied for tea and coffee so I bought my own. After working in this industry for over 15 years it is a shame to see what people are being offered, the hotels I worked in provided real milk, glasses to drink out of (not just wine glasses), 10 satchels of coffee/tea/sugar, higher quality room service menu/food and rooms were spotless. Oh well it looks like unless you stay at the well known hotel chains you really are not getting any value for money. On departure I noticed an airline pilot complaining to the manager about the same I have enclosed.

Reviews.Title: “negelected, run down and dirty hotel for the money we spent 1 night!!”
Reviews.Author: peoplewhotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel years ago and it was nice, but on my return stay i was very disappointed. Our room was not ready as promised so we had lunch at their cafe. They let the hotel become very run down, the hallway carpet needed replacing or a good clean! The walls needed a good paint job! We had lunch at their cafe, which was very untidy, dirty tables and floor and the food was not good. Our room was also very run down. Bathroom dirty. The one chair we had in our room looked like it came from Vinnies! We were very diappointed and will not recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Liked it”
Reviews.Author: JaidaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights last week. Overall, we liked the Vibe, it was a good value for our money. The only negative thing is that we were on a floor with a load of tour customers from China. They were very load with the banging doors and talking very loudly in groups in the hall... this happened all one evening but stopped at abut 10 pm.. only to begin again about 630 am. It was very disturbing but admittedly, not the Hotel's fault. The desk staff were sympathetic and listenned to our frustrations. I would just suggest that when checking in you make sure you don't get put on a floor with a tour group. The staff were very helpful and freindly. This hotel is a very short walk (uphill but not a long one) to a place where you can take the double decker tour bus (hop on and hop off... and also connects for no extra cost to a bus to Bondi Beach).. I would suggest getting the 24 hour pass on that bus for about $25 and get an idea of how the city is laid out. It also makes for easy transport to Sydney harbour and back. One night after dinner downtown Sydney we took a cab back to the Vibe and the cab fare was a pleasant $10.. (with tip). There is an airport transport bus that can be booked to pick you up right at the hotel for $14 a person .. There is a great Thai food restaurant next door as well as other restaurants and a beer and wine store on the same block (attached to a pub/restaurant). Overall, it was a fine place to stay (if you don't get a noisy floor). We didn't use the pool but did go up to look around and it seems clean and would be a nice place to hang out if you feel like a pool day. I didn't see a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, comfortable, close to Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: jclewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, in room 534. We really liked the look of the room, its new contemporary fittings, clean bathroom, comfortable bed. Room service wasn't too expensive, and there are a couple of places nearby to by wine from to put in your fridge. It was actually close to Kings Cross area, taking around 10 mins to walk there. Lots of places to eat and drink around that area, and there is a bus stop for the open top sightseeing bus. There was also a pick up point for the cheaper minibus to the airport also nearby, although it is a slight up hill walk with suitcases, but worth it for a cheap way to get to the airport. Really liked this hotel, very friendly staff, clean rooms. Didn't go to the bar, restaurant or swimming pool though. It was very quiet when we were there, a lot of rooms seemed empty, but good for us with no noise.

Reviews.Title: “TRENDY,CLEAN, GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravellet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. The hotel as a whole is clean, trendy and newly refurbished. Our room was very spacious. The view from the pool area/penthouse is just fantastic! There is a park and a bay adjacent to the hotel......You feel like you are in a sanctuary while at thesame time, the CBD is just several blocks away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the detail”
Reviews.Author: Lark01
Reviews.Content: I stayed for seven nights at the Vibe whilst attending a friend's wedding in Sydney. Overall it's a good value-for-money hotel in a great location. My room, which overlooked the park, was large and well appointed with tea & coffee making facilities, iron & ironing board, a very comfortable king-sized bed and a generous bathroom. The reception staff were efficient, obliging and helpful, as was the housekeeping staff who responded very promptly to my request for additional coat hangers. I enjoyed an excellent room service dinner on one of the evenings that I just wanted a quiet night in: delicious food, nicely presented and I didn't have to wait an age for it to arrive. The downside? Well, the breakfast is mediocre so my tip would be to order a decent cup of coffee from the bar then go out for breakfast; the internal sound proofing is not great; my used room service tray remained ignored outside my room for more than 24 hours (yes really!) and some dead leaves by the lift on my floor were there for the entire duration of my stay. They are so almost there with the Vibe, but it's all in the detail so a little more care and attention would not come amiss. However, the yardstick is always 'would I go back?' and the answer is yes, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: roseyfam
Reviews.Content: Great deal included parking and breakfast. Great location - room was nicely decorated and clean. Very quiet. Staff were very helpful. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was...okay”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: We never planned on staying there, but our reseverations at the Chiffley Potts Point was moved over to The Vibe because the Chiffley started doing unexpected manitence. The Vibe was nice enough to honor our rates so we thought we'd give it a try. It is far from the opera house, walking about and hour. But it is located 10 minutes walk away from Kings Cross, which is a huge party place for young adults. But my husband and I weren't interested in that. There is a train stop at Kings Cross so the hotel isnt to far of a walk from there. When we got to the hotel the front desk was friendly and checked us in early. You could tell the hotel was trying to cover up its tired old look and lack of decor with a few bright colors here and there. The room was okay. A little below average with barely any decor and a small tv. The breakfast buffet was the same: just okay. My husband was mad that they charged us 8 dollars for two VERY small hot coco's when all the other hot beverages ( coffee, tea, etc) was free and we were under the impression it was free also from the waiter. He complained and they didn't charge us. Internet is about 24 bucks a day! It has a good location if your into the party side of Sydney, but other then that it was far from the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “God location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Jkrebbs
Reviews.Content: This Hotel offers great value and a good location but is not a hotel I would recommend. The staff at the desk was wonderful and that made our stay at least a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Vibes”
Reviews.Author: fiftys0methings
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start and end of our 4 week holiday in Oz and found it to be one of the best hotels overall. The location next to Rushcutters Park and on the main road for easy access for buses and trains into the city and main beaches made it very convenient and the hotel itself was bright, clean, friendly and welcoming in fact on our return for the last 2 days it almost felt like coming home. The room was one of the best we've had for good lighting and mirrors, and there's plenty of 'worktop' and shelf space for all your bags and bits when you are living out of a suitcase. The hotel has half price drinks at happy hour every day, which was very welcome although the snacks were rarely seen. There's also a rooftop swimming pool which proved a little too popular at times when some guests seemed to take over with their own pool party, but the pool was great to enjoy after a day's sight seeing. The hotel also has a number of good cafes close by - Ash's on the corner which we used a lot - fantastic food, the little hut in the park which served a good range of snacks while you sit and enjoy the harbour scenery, Key Largo bar and food next door and Elvis night at Elvis pizza across the road is an absolute MUST DO - we had a brilliant time - Las Vegas eat your heart out. All in all we found Vibes pretty good value for money the only downside was on 2 occasions, on weekends they closed the bar and restaurant facilities to residents for wedding functions. Not that it mattered too much with the alternative choices available nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Rushcutters could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandJan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rushcutters from 22/12/09 - 28/12/09. It was clean with a good standard of housekeeping. Excellent location for the Sydney Yacht Club. On several nights of our stay we didn't have access to the bar or restaurant as there were private functions being held in both. I have never been in a hotel where the bar & restaurant have been closed to residents. I used the gym on several occasions and would say that the equipment was in need of servicing/replacement and some pieces were decidedly dangerous. The level of cleanliness in the gym and at the pool side was not good. The area opened at 7am but was not cleaned until well after 8am and towels were not available until much later in the morning. There didn't appear to any further visits by staff during the day. The service provided by the reception staff very much depended on who was on duty. Very often they were surly and not particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Snwbrder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly because of the price and the location. For budget accommodation this is a great find. We have paid more to say in a pub in the city before. The bed was comfy and we had a nice view looking at the park and the CYC. My only complaint was there was a faint smell of smoke even though we had a smoke free room someone had obviously smoked in it and the smell wasn't quite out of there. There was a great cafe at the corner for breakfast in the morning. This was cheaper than getting taxis all night!

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LagunaMandy
Reviews.Content: I actually spent a day at this hotel , visiting my ex-husband when he was in town...I cannot believe people who reviewed this hotel expected so much! The price for most nights is average $165 and it is , after all, a 3.5 star hotel! given that Sydney is not that cheap (to stay in or near the city centre) I am not sure why people would expect so much. It used to be a TRAVELODGE for goodness sake! Travelodge = AVERAGE in my extensive travel experience of the world. Why anybody coming to Sydney would particularly want to stay in this area I dont know, I wouldnt .... but then I am a local Sydneysider... Look there are lots of alternatives to staying next to what locals know as "drug park " i.e. Rushcutters Bay Park. This park is known by locals to be full of syringes from addicts hitting up after wandering down from "drug & hooker central" (Kings Cross) which is a mere 5 minute walk from this hotel. Yes, it's not far to get to the city centre, Opera House, shops, QVB etc but if you research a bit more and be realistic about what price buys you in hotels then disappointed you won't be next time... when you DONT book VIBE Hotel Rushcutters Bay. I would never recommend this hotel to out of town clients or friends of mine. My ex-husband was only staying at this hotel as his (Mean) company put him up there on business. He wouldnt have chosen it himself in a fit! There are so many great places to stay in Sydney... if you went up the road to Woollahra, a much nicer suburb and looked at The Hughenden Hotel (boutique hotel) for a similar price as VIBE then you would have a much better experience!

Reviews.Title: “got a view of the drain next door... and ALOT of rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_jNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend as we attended the annual CLEO swimsuit launch party. It was very easy to find and were booked with a king size bed. Upon arriving, reception seemed dull and not very happy to be at work. But were ok to us. Our room was on the 1st floor and upon opening the door could smell cigarette smoke coming from the airconditioning vents. I was also woken up in the middle of the night as the smell was YUK! Upon opening our blinds to see the view outside... all we saw was AWFUL rubbish and the drain... Our 'king' size bed, was actually 2 single beds joined together. We found this out by the zipper sticking into my boyfriends back. But to our surprise, the beds were comfy, which i was very relieved. We ordered room service. That was actually nice. I had a caesar salad which was good. The price for that was ok too. Bathroom was ok. a few marks, but at least it was a toilet and shower, which was all we needed. Ckeck out was quick and easy and car was parked in a secure park under the hotel. But beware, It SMELLS of the drain next to the hotel. I wouldnt stay here again, but at least we could sleep somewhere for the night, that wasnt in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “best in sydney”
Reviews.Author: srikanth117
Reviews.Content: gr8hotel, decent price, nice locality, friendly staff, i would rate 5 stars for the housekeeping department, because their service is the best . clean rooms, friendly staff, all n all good hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: KlutzyGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and was thoroughly dissapointed. Staff were rude, marks all over the walls, very cheap furniture and flimsy beds. The pool up top is nice, but it wasn't heated as it was supposed to be. Don't be fooled by your "view of the park" room, my "park view' also included a view of bayswater road.. this place is trying to be like a W but has a long way to go. Plus it's out of the way from everything. Book a B&B in Potts Point instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great loved the place”
Reviews.Author: ozmatt07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights and loved the place. Just out of the hustle bustle of the city so great for anyone driving & not wanting to go right into the city or people who don't mind travelling a couple of stops on the train to get into the city. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms were clean and bright modern design. Had dinner in the restaurant and it was lovely! The breakfast was fabulous and so worth getting. Smoked salmon was my favourite along with everything else you could imagine - this was my favourite part of the stay!! Lovely leafy, quiet spot, you can walk to the yacht club and its a great little morning walk, very pretty that you wouldn't think you are in the city. The restaurant area is in a nice spot and you can in or outside. The pool area is excellent too. I would reccommend this property to any travellers. Thanks Lisa.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: blsoom
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at this hotel but the whole experience was extraordinarily disapointing. Rooms were okay and the service was so so....but for a hotel of that standard, the feel was really poor. And the rates? Give me a break. I got to pay over $50 dollars a day for the internet which turned out to be 1/3 of the cost of the room! Not to mention that it did not work in every room and I was made to change rooms 3 times in order to get a room where it worked. In this day and age, all rooms should have internet and frankly, it really ought to be free...I stayed there for 4 days and must have financed the internet consumption of a small village in the bush! Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: holiday888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good price which is why we stayed there. For the price theres not too much to complain about, however it did feel like some corners were cut. e.g bathroom door didnt go all the way to the floor. the room itself was also pretty small. There was no where to sit apart from the bed. if you want a place to crash for one or two nights max, and dont plan on spending any othe time in your room, this hotel would be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Vibe”
Reviews.Author: White-family
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vibe Hotel for a week in March 2007 and thought what a comfortable nice place it was to stay. Location adjacent to Rushcutters Bay, park and waterfront very pleasant - of course if you want to be right in Circular Quay this won't be the hotel for you. But taxis and buses are cheap and plentiful so no problem in getting around. Positives: good modern rooms, nicely presented, clean, good bar and restaurant, internet access, friendly staff. I cannot believe how some people complain about hotel staff, if you are polite and friendly and smile, normally they will reciprocate. Negatives: the number of tour groups - Japanese mainly but some English and Chinese - may be offputting to the independent traveller and do clutter up the reception at times, but this happens in most city hotels. As mentioned, the hotel may not be central enough for some. Depending on what rate you pay, I thought the Vibe was a good option for staying in Sydney which is a fabulous city and deserves 5-7 days at least for sightseeing. Besides the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, harbour trips, beaches, Darling Harbour - Aquarium etc, Botanical Gardens, Hyde Park Barracks Museum - fascinating account of convict life in Sydney & immigration, Art Museum, Zoo, the list goes on and on, - there is also the Blue Mountains, Hunter Valley wine area, wildlife parks and lots of other stuff to see around Sydney. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Vibe is a Bit Vapid”
Reviews.Author: CyU
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: Christina & Uddy Date: February 5th We stayed here one night when our preferred choice, The Altamont, was fully booked. The Vibe wasn't all that. While the location was fine-next to a beautiful park and marina, the staff were not that friendly and the internet service was quite expensive. At one point, the lobby and elevator area was starting to look like a grocery store parking lot with all of the luggage carts shamefully hanging around. The room was clean and the bathroom spacious, but overall, the Vibe seemed to be striving too hard to be hip and yet missed the mark still.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: This is a great value, 4 star hotel. I paid $110 for a night, and for this price got a great king bed room, with a large bathroom. It is not luxury, but for $110 a night, the hotel is very comfortable and clean. The beds are great, with nice linen. Room service and mini bar are also very reasonably priced. I would happily return at the price I paid, it was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PUO
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. I wanted peace and quiet and easy access to the sailing marinas, yet to be in walking distance to Darlinghurst. Although I had booked a superior Parkview room, I opted, on inspection, to downgrade to a standard room. The standard room (though without view of the Park or the marina) was slightly larger than the Parkview room! And quieter because there were late night parties (with blaring music) going on directly below the Parkview rooms. Anyway I got my peace and quiet and easy walking to the Marina. I was a bit taken aback at the rooms and the general feel of the Hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were small / medium sized. Likewise, the bathroom. It was a no-fuss, no-frills room. The general feel of the hotel, reception, lounge etc did not seem to me to be a 4 star hotel. It reminded me of the 3 star european chain hotels - a bit "plasticky". The check in and staff were helpful in shuffling me about and handling my whims and fancies. They were also very helpful and knowledgeable about restaurants and places to go shopping. I needed a traveller's multiplug and sicssors, and newspapers. No problems - immediate with a smile. The hotel is next door to a provision store and a pub. So drinks and snacks were cheap - no need to spend huge sums of money on these at the hotel. A 10 minute walk to / from Kings Cross / Darlinghurst. Great for entertainment/nice meals/drinks A short 10 minute taxi ride to St George, Town Hall, etc for great shopping. Overall, not a bad but not a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but has no vibe”
Reviews.Author: Mazworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vibe after a very long flight from Singapore. Beds were very comfortable and facilities were excellent particularly the pool. But the hotel just seemed to be poorly managed. Though staff at reception were friendly. Breakfast staff just didn't seem interested in serving you breakfast. We thought it was overpriced and lacked character so we checked out and stayed at a smaller but in the middle of it all hotel in Darlinghurst road. This is a decent hotel but I'm sure you can get better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: wpsp
Reviews.Content: This place could be called FAULTY TOWERS. We spent several days here, and the only reason we did not leave was becasue this was the only hotel situated near to the place we had to be. And, after two weeks of fabulous travel in NZ, we did not want to pack up yet again. The staff is poorly trained, though try to accomodate. Wake up calls never came, mesages were not delivered, the sheets were not changed on daily basis, the in room interent did not work. We changed rooms 4 times in 7 days. The in room safe did not work in any of the rooms. One day, they forgot to make up the room--and when we returned in late afternoon, the maid staff had left. This place caters to large Asian groups who come in for a day or 2 and spend little time in rooms---although I heard a few screamimg at the staff in their native languages. Try somewhere else. Sydney is a beautiul city full of much better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Looks tired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here and not impressed. Room was small, and in poor condition - wardrobe would not open, chipped furniture, dirty paint work, chipped doors. windows dirty. Staff not helpful - had to insist TWICE that breakfast was included in booking. No vibe here at all sorry - suggest the rydges jamison if you can afford it, superb views, great location, wonderful service and amazing rooms - worth it trust me

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: victoriacar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for a modern, stylish hotel in Sydney. We shopped around and compared this against the W and the Sebel Pier One and the price for this is substantially lower. Granted, it's not as nice as the W or Pier One, but it does has a similar modern feel. It has a nice bar attached to it and the restaurant has a good breakfast buffet. A few things to be aware of: 1) The location is a little out of the central area. You will need to take a bus to get to the Harbour area, Circular Quay, etc. It's not a long ride - maybe 10 minutes or so - and it's fun to ride the bus with people going to work. We stayed here almost a week and we took the bus everywhere. The Kings Cross area is within walking distance of the hotel. 2) The rooms are small. They are hip and modern, but they are small. 3) Realize that it's a "good value" sort of place - it's not a luxury hotel. It's a mid-range boutique hotel. I think the photos on the web site make it seem more upscale than it is. If you don't go in expecting a 5-star experience, you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great value great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qupi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel newly refurbished just a short walk from the bars and cafes of Kings Cross and walking distance to Kings Cross station. Had a beautiful room overlooking Rushcutters bay park which was not large, but clean and very comfortable. Staff were very obliging. The beautiful rooftop pool and gym overlooked Sydney Harbour - Wow! Will certainly return on my next visit to Sydney because is extreamly good value compared with other 4 star Sydney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe Rushcutters: Stylish and a good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel's now called Vibe Rishcutters and, having stayed twice, I can tell you the vibe is good - if you'll pardon the pun. The rooms have a minimalistic but extremely swish styling, with fantasically comfortable beds, seating, and a very nice bathroom. There's also a rather large in-room electronic safe - a big plus if, like me, you travel with a laptop. Everything's well kept and very clean. On both my stays I found the staff pleasant and helpful. As for location, the hotel's right next to the harbour and a beautiful park. The latter has a wonderful outdoor cafe for brunch at the weekend. Transport's pretty good. Buses to the CBD are just across the road (takes about 8 minutes), with the subway 5 minutes walk up the hill. Kings Cross, with its 'delightful' nightlife and strange characters, is 10 minutes walk the other way. Having said that, the hotel isn't in the Cross and the surrounding area is safe. I'd highly recommend the Vibe Ruscutters. It makes a great base to explore Sydney without the extortionate cost of staying in the CBD itself. Mind you, don't use the hotel's broadband internet or lobby net kiosk. Both are ridiculously expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best hotels in Sydney I have stayed at, especially for the price. The staff were fantastic - no fuss, check in, room ready, easy, quick, no problems. The rooms are decorated very stylishly, with big feather pillows and feather doona on the beds. The location is second to none - just a quick pleasant walk to Oxford St, and the CBD, with rushcutters bay park, the marina and cute little cafes right on the doorstep. I couldnt fault this place, and will definately be back, what a lovely relaxing experience the whole thing was!!

HotelInfo.Name: Vibe Hotel Rushcutters
